phrase.item: A miller,
there was a miller.
He went to the mill, (but) it was already sunset time.
He put his wheat into the belly [of the mill] and it got darker outside,
evening closed in.
Then he saw five people coming.
He said, "Those people came to the mill at the wrong time.
They didn't come when it was sunny, now it's evening time and all five of these people have come."
He couldn't tell if they were people or demons.
In fact, they were demons.
Then he looked carefully and saw that they were demons.
All five of them were demons.
He said, "Well, they are not going to let me stay alive here, they will cut me to pieces."
Then he jumped into the belly [of the mill],
inside the wheat, into the belly of the mill,
which was shaped like a triangle, and he buried himself there [in the wheat].
He buried himself inside the wheat. The mill was milling the grain. He buried himself in there and [the demons] entered.
They entered and one of them was the commander.
For the [other] four devils, the fifth one was the boss. He said, "Now, you go and bring a pot, wothout calling God's name [bismillah]"
He said [this] to the first one.

He said to the second one, "You go and bring some roof beams already cut short [for a fire], without calling God's name." He said to the third one, "You go and bring a bull without calling God's name from pen"

He said to the forth one. "You go and collect some stuff, anything from outside, and when they slaughter the bull, keep the skin and fill it up with anything [in place of the meat], and then let the bull go to his owner by itself.
It will make different sounds, "gling glop", and the owner won't recognize it.
He will say it is his bull.
Then they made a hole in the bull, blew into it, and take off the skin.

They take off the skin, and since they were demons they pulled it off without a knife, using wood instead. They cooked and ate [the rest of the whole bull] that night. The mill continued milling grain, it kept going for a long time but the [milling of the] wheat was never finished.
The man was still inside the belly [of the mill].
The miller was inside the belly, and when morning came [the demons] said, "Well, let's go now."
They came out of the mill, and they cooked the meat [next to the] mill as well.
Then... It was about sunrise time, and [one of the demons] said, "Well, get up and go.
We should go because it is getting light outside.
The four of them came out and then last the commander, the fifth one after them, and [the miller] jumped from the belly and grabbed him by the neck.
"Hey," said [the demon], "who are you, for God's sake, are you a human being or a fairy, what are you?
"Whatever wishes you have," the demon told him. "We'll make them come true.
Just please don't hold on to my collar."
The man replied, "I am the miller."
[The devil] said, "Ok, what is your aim?"
"Whatever God permits, I will do it for you."[And the miller replied,] "Well, I have this giant rock here, and I need to open a water channel. It is very hard and I cannot do it."
"I will carve it out for you!" [said the demon].
"I will make your water channel come,"
says the demon to him,
to the miller.
"I will do it for you," he said.
"What are your other dreams?" he asked.
He said, "[I want this] desert, and that other desert."
"Don't tell me this and that desert," [said the demon],
"I have whatever [power] was left to me by my father, but I'm not going to interfere with another man's space."
[The miller said]: "For me, come to those fifty meters of the rock mountain, come and carve it."
The devils made the water channel come.
Then they made [the water] come out, they made that for him. The [miller] entered his neighbor's house and asked, "Where is your boiling pot?"
"My pot is in its place," [said the neighbor].
"Okay, go and check if it's there."
They went and checked, and the pot was not in its place.
[The miller] said, "Shame on your father. God's name [bismillah] is not in your house."
"You," he said to another neighbor, "you who made the roof beam short to build a house, is your roof beam there?"
"Well, where can the roof beam be?" he replied.
He went and saw that the roof beam was not there.
"You made [the roof beam] short," [said the miller], "without calling God's name."
He said to another one, "How about your bull?"
"What my bull, my bull is at home!" said the man.
"Where can my bull go?
It's in the fold."
"Okay," said the miller, "go slaughter it,
[and see] if it has meat inside or just detritus."
He slaughtered it, and in fact [the demons had] gathered everything and put it inside.
The neighbor was surprised and said, "Ohhh, you are a keeper of many secrets, you know everything.
How did you know this?"

"I have [called] God's name," he replied. "I went through this, I have seen this kind of work and what has been done. A mountain of rock I cannot handle, like this they came [and carved a channel], because you were not calling God's name.

All of your things the demons did like that. They slaughtered the bull and ate it, and when they said grace [after the meal] the bull came into the fold. Here is the boiling pot, the roof beam, they are all here.
You are not aware. You don't have God's name, call God's name now, and everything will be blessed.
If you don't have God's name in your mouth, the demons will take you over and own you.
Then the [people] came to an agreement and humanity appeared in them.
Before that, there had been ijowa [evil?], there was no calling of God's name.
To work without calling God's name is to be unblessed-- things enter through the door and go up through the chimney. Nothing stays, no matter how hard you work.
